title: Mr.suevie
author: Mr.suevie
content: Bitcoin is really pulling waved all over in Africa and most people who are exposed to it are really breaking out of the financial entrapment they have been in some many years by the government controled fiat currency. Me myself i have been through hell trying to save money in my fiat currency and instead of the banks to be securing your money instead in my place here the banks actually cut your money and destabilized your whole plan you have for that money. But the awareness i have seen so far about this bitcoin innovation in my area is really something else its like everyone around me has exploded in saving their money in bitcoin which I still don't how its operate but am curious and interested in finding out more so i was directed here for more exposure by a friend and am hoping am going get everything right here about this massive awareness in my area about bitcoin.

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. Read the forum rules to make your experience here easierhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0#post_rulesI can’t say I’m surprised that more people are learning of bitcoin and bitcointalk forum, judging by the work I see on the forum about forum members in Africa spreading the bitcoin gospel to their family, friends and anyone who cares to listen. Even the newbies are in a haste to teach bitcoin to others so I can only hope the awareness you got was the right one. Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AMBitcoin is really pulling waved all over in Africa and most people who are exposed to it are really breaking out of the financial entrapment they have been in some many years by the government controled fiat currency. Fiat isn’t the cause of poverty just as bitcoin isn’t going to make you rich, you need fiat to buy bitcoin. Even though you say your friends are all saving their money in bitcoin, you should know that bitcoin is volatile, saving $1000 in bitcoin right now can turn to $990 or 1080 the next day.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AM~snip~First of all welcome to one of the oldest and legitimate bitcoin discussion forum where you can get abundant of knowledge regarding bitcoin and you can also educate others about the same.As directed above you can have a look at the rules and regulations of this forum so you don't violate any of the rules and can continue your journey here without any worry.We already have CAR accepting bitcoin as legal tender but don't have the exact reports of how well the conditions are there.No doubt when you learn about bitcoin and financial freedom you automatically feels how the central chain of authorities and the banking system are curbing us and putting us in fiat trap but bitcoin breaks all of it and enlighten us to path of freedom.But speaking frankly if you say keeping your money into it then we must be familiar with risk associated with it like volatility so you should have in mind that investing for long term is beneficial.The wages are not so high and you must plan wisely the amount you are willing to invest or risk the amount you are willing to loose in it.You can also have DCA approach which means investing periodically the fixed amount like weekly, monthly or quarterly for long term and you will learn about it.The next thing is keeping your funds safe in non custodial wallets or hardware wallets which are expensive but your funds are safe unless you are not responsible.These are some things which I am guiding you while bitcoin investment but you will learn a lot with time.So now if you are interested about learning bitcoin then you can watch these  videos from Andreas Antonopoulos  which will guide you in effective manner You can browse through various threads on forum like this   one from @fillippone to have knowledge about bitcoin and rest depends on how much dedicated you are to learn about it.Now as you said you are from Africa then we don't have any local board for it but if you are looking to communicate with same community you can start a thread in Other boardsBest wishes and hope there is bitcoin boost and adoption among your African community and you live better life.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AMBitcoin is really pulling waved all over in Africa and most people who are exposed to it are really breaking out of the financial entrapment they have been in some many years by the government controled fiat currency. If the financial entrapment is about government control, then quite rightly Bitcoin affords its users the freedom and control of their funds that's in the network, but if your statement connotes that Bitcoin is making these people rich, then mind you that Bitcoin is not a get rich quick scheme, but a sustainable long term project, and except these people are early adopters, they'll have to be patient for quite a long time to reap ROI on their investments.Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AMMe myself i have been through hell trying to save money in my fiat currency and instead of the banks to be securing your money instead in my place here the banks actually cut your money and destabilized your whole plan you have for that money.Bank charges are somewhat normal, but btw if you intend to save your money in the Bitcoin network, ensure you do it the correct way, do not save it in a centralized exchange, but in a wallet that only you has the keys too, mind you: not your keys, not your coins.Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AMBut the awareness i have seen so far about this bitcoin innovation in my area is really something else its like everyone around me has exploded in saving their money in bitcoin which I still don't how its operate but am curious and interested in finding out more so i was directed here for more exposure by a friend and am hoping am going get everything right here about this massive awareness in my area about bitcoin. There is a rule of thumb that you shouldn't forget, and that's to invest only what you can afford to lose, thus as you save your money in the Bitcoin network, mind you that you should do so with a money that you can afford to lose. Having said that, Bitcoin awareness is becoming a thing, but people are not massively saving their money in Bitcoin like you say, they still trust the bank because many haven't acquired the knowledge of being their own bank, and as a noob that you are, it is much better for you to leave your money in the bank for now, and when you've understood how to use the network you can then gradually build up your Bitcoin stash.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: It's interesting, I saw a lot of threads now that come from newbies who have an interest in Bitcoin, it might this was the result of those threads also that created teaching in their neighborhood or in church. Welcome to the forum and you're in the right place to learn about Bitcoin, just read all sticky threads (pinned post) here.  Just keep reading until you'll learn, as a newbie, it's ideal to spend more time reading than posting here in the forum. Understand what investment you've in because Bitcoin is very volatile and every now and then it will fluctuate and it might one day you'll confuse seeing your portfolio lose its value.  Bitcoin is the best investment, when it comes to savings it means it's a long-term holding and Bitcoin is very suitable for that choice.

comments.body: Quote from: Mr.suevie on December 16, 2022, 11:00:18 AMBitcoin is really pulling waved all over in Africa and most people who are exposed to it are really breaking out of the financial entrapment they have been in some many years by the government controled fiat currency. Also on the forum the inflow of Africans and those willing to write about what's happening over here has increased as well. It gives me joy seeings all this which only points to one direction that Bitcoin is truely here to stay. As for savings with banks, I don't know much about other western world but in general it's not advisable to save your money with banks since inflation will eat alway all the profits you'll be expecting. African banks typically are horrible, at every opportunity they get they'll want to take money away from you even when you open an account with them just for saving of your money.Stick with Bitcoin buddy, you're better off hoarding money in Bitcoin than the banks, ignore the volatility of the price, long term you stand to benefits as Bitcoin is design in a way that the price will keep increasing provided the demand is present.

comments.author: Resident coin
comments.body: Speaking of bitcoin awareness, the use of cryptocurrency in africa has recently increased dramatically and some researchers have been made and it has been realised that African countries are among the top countries in term of bitcoin adoption. Some countries in Africa are rapidly using fiat currencies to purchase bit coin because of the growing population of bitcoin in Africa. So many merchant have now accepted bitcoin payment as bitcoin adoption grows and am very sure that the use of cryptocurrency will become a standard world wide.But come to think of it ,there are still countries were cryptocurrencies are not allowed which we need to look at.The reason some countries hesitate in crypto adoption in Africa and other part of the world is its volatility. This is actually because no one has control over the mining process. Most crypto mining process takes place on personal computers.Despite all this,the number of businesses accepting cryptocurrency as payment method remains high.I just hope that the issue of bitcoin volatility would be solved soon because many countries see crypto currency as a way to increase their wealth.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: The awareness rate of bitcoin in Africa is very high mostly Nigeria in particular. The way Fiat banks are deducting Bankers (customers) money in their various banks is very worrisome. Now to keep money in the bank is not interested by many because of the cutting rate. If you keep $50,000 in the Fiat bank for like 5 months or 10 years and when you go bank and check your balance in the bank, you would discovered that the amount which you deposited has been drastically reduced. So many people instead of using Fiat banks to keep their money they like to use bitcoin wallet to keep which can stay for a very long period and you bitcoin is still intact. It would never reduced. But the amount you will get for the long run will be determined by your country's currency strength.
